Ingredients: 1 medium head of cabbage, thinly sliced
1/4 cup cooking oil (vegetable, canola, or olive oil)
Optional: red pepper flakes for heat
Instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add sliced onion and cook until softened and translucent.
Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Be careful not to burn the garlic.
Add sliced cabbage to the skillet. Stir-fry until cabbage is tender-crisp and slightly caramelized, about 8-10 minutes.

In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, apple cider vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper, and optional red pepper flakes. Pour sauce over the cabbage mixture and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes, until sauce is evenly distributed and cabbage is well coated.

Ingredients: Optional: Small squares of parchment paper
Instructions: Combine flour, yeast, sugar, and salt in a bowl. Add lukewarm milk and softened butter; knead until a smooth dough forms. Let rise for about 1 hour.
Divide the dough into equal portions (e.g., 7-8 pieces), shape into smooth round buns, and place each on a small square of parchment paper.
Place the buns in a steamer and steam over medium heat for 12-15 minutes. Ensure the steamer has enough water and avoid overcrowding.
Remove from steamer, let cool slightly before serving. Enjoy these fluffy buns plain or with fillings of your choice.

Ingredients: 8 oz dried noodles (such as ramen, lo mein, or rice noodles)
1 cup chopped vegetables (such as carrots, bell peppers, green onions, and peas)
Optional: protein such as tofu, chicken, or shrimp
Instructions: Cook noodles according to package directions, then toss with sesame oil and set aside.
Scramble eggs in a pan until cooked, then set aside. Stir-fry vegetables until tender.
Combine soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, ginger, and garlic in a bowl to make the sauce.
Add noodles, eggs, and sauce to the vegetables and stir-fry until heated through. Serve immediately.

Ingredients: 1/4 cup shredded cheese (cheddar, Monterey Jack, or your choice)
1/4 cup cooked and diced meat (bacon, sausage, or ham)
1/4 cup diced vegetables (onion, bell pepper, tomatoes)
Optional: salsa, hot sauce, avocado for serving
Instructions: Whisk eggs with milk/cream, salt, and pepper. Scramble in a non-stick pan until cooked through, then stir in cheese, meat, and vegetables.
Warm the tortilla in a dry skillet or microwave until pliable.
Place the egg mixture in the center of the tortilla, fold in the sides, and roll up tightly.
Serve immediately with optional toppings like salsa, hot sauce, or avocado.

Ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken thighs or breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
Instructions: Prepare chicken by coating in flour, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika, then fry until golden and crispy.
Make the sauce by whisking together honey, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and red pepper flakes. Thicken it with cornstarch slurry if needed.
Toss fried chicken in the prepared sauce until well coated.
Garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds and serve immediately.
